lines.gurmukhi: haumY AiBmwn kY AigAwnqw AvigAw gur inMdw gur dwsn kY nwm gurdws hY
lines.transliteration_english: Haoumai Abhimaan Kai Agiaanataa Avagiaa Gur , Nindaa Gur Daasan Kai Naam Gurdaas Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Under the influence of self-pride, ego and ignorance, I show scant respect to the Guru and indulge in slander of his servants. Yet I have named myself the slave of Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: mhurw khwvY mITw geI so khwvY AweI rUTI kau khq quTI hoq auphws hY
lines.transliteration_english: Mahuraa Kahaavai Meetthaa Gaee So Kahaavai Aaee , Rootthee Kau Kahat Toutthee Hot Oupahaas Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: This is like poisonous root or tuber of Aconytum Ferox (Mitha Mauhra) that is called sweet or an infected eye that is called 'akh ai hai' and one who suffers from smallpox is said to have been visited and blessed by mother (Mata). This is a big joke.

lines.gurmukhi: bwNJ khwvY spUqI duhwgin suhwgin kurIiq surIiq kwitE nktw ko nws hY
lines.transliteration_english: Baanjh Kahaavai Sapootee Duhaagani Suhaagani , Kureeti Sureeti Kaatiao Nakataa Ko Naas Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just out of fun a barren woman is called Saputi (one blessed with sons), an abandoned woman is called happily married, it is no different than calling an evil rite as auspicious or one with chopped nose as beautiful.

lines.gurmukhi: bwvro khwvY Boro AwNDrY khY sujwKo cMdn smIp jYsy bwsu n subws hY ]191]
lines.transliteration_english: Baavaro Kahaavai Bhoro Aandharai Kahai Sujaakho , Chandan Sameep Jaisay Baasu N Soubaas Hai ?191?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a crazy person is addressed as simpleton, or a blind person who can see are all a crazy and wrong expressions, Similarly a bamboo tree even if it thrives in the close proximity of a Sandalwood tree cannot acquire its fragrance, so would a person l
